meta.name: Courses Dashboard Design System
meta.purpose: Codify the visual and interaction language of the reference dashboard so AI agents can reliably reproduce the same look-and-feel across the NexSkill LMS ecosystem.
brandPersonality: Focused on productivity and learning outcomes

shellLayout.behavior: Desktop-first three-column layout: left navigation rail, central content canvas, right contextual panel. Collapse right rail to expandable drawer on smaller breakpoints.

500.usage: Core brand purple; primary actions, active states, key accents.

300.usage: Soft bars, backgrounds for metrics and tags.

500.usage: Hero gradients, promotional banners, high-energy callouts.

surfaceMuted.usage: Soft blocks, secondary chips, subtle dividers.

borderSubtle.usage: Card outlines, separators, table row dividers.

warning.usage: Subtle alerts and thresholds if needed.

danger.usage: Destructive actions and error states, used sparingly.

shadowStrong.usage: Modals, floating elements like tooltips and dropdowns.

heroPrimary.usage: Hero banner backgrounds and high-visibility promotional tiles.

chartBars.usage: Metric bars in the right-rail analytics component.

avatarRing.usage: Profile ring accents for key users.

usageGuidelines: Use bold weights (600–700) for primary titles, hero copy, and navigation labels to maintain strong hierarchy.
Use medium weights (500) for card titles, buttons, and major labels.
Use regular weights (400) for body copy and descriptions to keep the interface readable and low-friction.
Overlines and pill labels rely on small uppercase text with increased letter spacing to feel crisp and premium.

patterns: Cards use 24–32 padding internally depending on content density.
Vertical gaps between stacked elements inside cards typically 8–16.
Navigation rail and right panel maintain generous padding to avoid visual congestion.

guidelines: Core visual language is soft and rounded; avoid sharp corners except for small utility elements.
Primary containers and hero sections use large radius (24–32) to feel friendly and high-end.
Interactive pills and tags are fully rounded for a modern streaming-dashboard aesthetic.

card.usage: Main content cards and hero tiles.

soft.usage: Small floating items such as dropdowns, tooltips, and floating action buttons.

none.usage: For flat elements within already elevated containers.

iconography.style: Rounded, minimal line icons with consistent stroke weight.
guidelines: Icons are always secondary to labels; never rely on icons alone for critical navigation.
Use the primary purple color for active icons and neutral greys for inactive states.

AppShell.role: High-level frame that orchestrates sidebar, central content, and right contextual rail.

structure.contentContainer: centered max-width card with surface.surface and shell radius
structure.layout: CSS grid or flex with three primary columns: sidebar, main content, right rail.

SidebarNav.role: Primary navigation and identity anchor for the learning platform.

content.logoLockup: Compact wordmark with brand icon in primary purple.
content.navItems: Icon + label, left-aligned, using h3/body type scale.

activeItem.indicator: Subtle left bar or pill highlight in primary color

friendsBlock.item: Small avatar + name + role in two-line layout.

TopSearchBar.role: Global course search and discovery entry point.

layout.alignment: Icon, placeholder text, right-side utility icons (filter).

visuals.outline: Subtle inner shadow or 1px border in borderSubtle.
visuals.icons: Neutral when idle; primary color on focus or interaction.

HeroBanner.role: Primary promotional surface for featured course or campaign.

contentZones: Left zone: course label, headline, subcopy, primary CTA.
Right zone: abstract 3D object and soft gradient background.

visuals.background: gradients.heroPrimary with soft blob illustration overlay.

ctaButton.contrastMode: Dark pill (near-black) against bright gradient to maximize click salience.

HeroStatsStrip.role: Horizontal row of mini-stat cards indicating watched progress for multiple tracks.

layout.container: Full-width white strip with 16–20 padding and large border radius.
layout.items: Equally spaced mini-cards with icon, progress label, and course type.

miniCard.icon: Circular pill with subtle purple tint.
miniCard.text: Two-line stack: progress metric line + category in smaller label.

SectionHeader.role: Reusable pattern for section titles like Continue Watching and Your Mentor.

layout.orientation: Horizontal row with left-aligned title and optional right-aligned action such as See All or carousel controls.

typography.title: h2
typography.subtitle: bodySecondary
typography.actions: caption or body with primary color.

CourseCardHorizontal.role: Primary tile for a course in Continue Watching.

structure: Top: thumbnail or visual preview covering full width with minor radius.
Bottom: label row (category pill), course title, metadata (avatars, progress, actions).

elements.categoryTag: Tag.pill with accentPink or primary color.
elements.avatars: Group of 3–5 overlapping avatars with subtle white border.
elements.metricChip: Small pill showing count (e.g., +124) in primary brand color.
elements.optionsIcon: Top right overflow menu icon in neutral color.

MentorTable.role: Tabular listing of mentors with their course type and topics.

visuals.hover: Background switch to surfaceMuted with subtle highlight.

RightRailProfileCard.role: Snapshot of current user profile and progress metrics.

stack: Avatar with gradient ring and greeting copy.

BarChartMetrics.role: Visual representation of learning progress over time.

layout.orientation: Horizontal bars increasing from left to right.

visuals.labels: Minimal; rely mostly on visual trend rather than detailed numeric ticks.

RightRailMentorList.role: Scrollable list of suggested mentors with follow actions.

itemLayout.background: surface.surface with optional alternating tinted rows.
itemLayout.structure: Avatar, name, role stacked vertically, Follow CTA aligned right.

seeAllButton.position: Pinned at bottom of card as full-width pill.

principles: Prioritize clarity over decoration: every visual choice must support discoverability of courses, actions, or progress.
Maintain a consistent three-column mental model: left for navigation, center for task execution, right for contextual insight and recommendations.
Lean into white space to prevent cognitive overload; never overpack a card or panel.
Use primary purple and pink gradients as strategic accents, not as defaults; they should highlight the most important actions and narratives on the screen.
Keep typography hierarchy disciplined: no more than three sizes in any given panel (title, body, meta).
All components should read as part of a cohesive card ecosystem: white surfaces, soft shadows, rounded corners, and aligned internal padding.
Motion should be subtle and functional: small hover lifts, fades, and slides that reinforce interactivity without distracting from the learning content.
Icons are supportive, not leading: pair them with labels and maintain consistent positioning and sizing across navigation and actions.
Use chips, tags, and pills to encode metadata (course type, counts, statuses) in a glanceable way; avoid long sentences when a compact label will do.
Right rail content should always feel like an assistant: profile info, metrics, and suggested mentors that complement, not compete with, the central learning tasks.
